aving more than two 
babies,	you	should	be	offered	
pregnancy care at a special 
clinic for multiple pregnancies. 
These clinics are not held in 
every hospital in Northern 
Ireland, and you might need 
to travel to another hospital. 
Your doctor might also refer 
you to the Regional Fetal 
Medicine Service in Belfast if 
you require more specialised 
care. If your babies are triplets 
or if they share a placenta it 
is recommended that you are 
scanned every two weeks 
from 16 weeks onwards,
